timeline.message: Remove offline usage of robolectric for now
See if I can get travis to accept licenses
Looks like travis adds the sdk manager bin folder to the path
Move back to 27 from 28 of build tools
Try 29 and upgrade emulator api level to 29
Looks like travis only support emulators targetting api level 25
Lets try installing our own emulator image
get rid of extraneous log output
say no to custom hardware profile
emulator needs to be run from specific folder
add sdk_root in one more place

timeline.bodyText: Have you thought about checking in a license file?
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,53 +1,49 @@
 # ./travis.yml for MSAL android
-language: android
-jdk: oraclejdk8
-
-# Don't use the Travis Container-Based Infrastructure
-sudo: true
+dist: bionic
 
 # Build Variables
 env:
   global:
-    - BUILD_TOOLS_VERSION=28.0.3
-    - COMPILE_SDK_VERSION=28
-    - EMULATOR_API_VERSION=21
-
-    # This is to guarantee a clean gradle log
-    - TERM=dumb
-
-android:
-  components:
-    - tools
-    - platform-tools
-    - build-tools-$BUILD_TOOLS_VERSION
-    - android-$COMPILE_SDK_VERSION
-    - extra-google-m2repository
-
-    ## Emulator config ##
-    # The SDK version used for the emulator
-    - android-$EMULATOR_API_VERSION
-
-    #system images
-    - sys-img-armeabi-v7a-android-$EMULATOR_API_VERSION
+    - BUILD_TOOLS_VERSION=29.0.3
+    - API_VERSION=29
+    - ANDROID_TOOLS=commandlinetools-linux-6609375_latest.zip
+    - ARCH=x86_64
 
 before_install:
+  # download and unzip Android SDK command line tools
+  - sudo apt install openjdk-8-jdk
+  - export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64 
+  - echo $JAVA_HOME
+  #- sudo update-alternatives --set java /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64/jre/bin/java
+  - wget -nv https://dl.google.com/android/repository/$ANDROID_TOOLS
+  - unzip -q $ANDROID_TOOLS -d $HOME/sdk
+  # set SDK tools path variable and ANDROID_HOME
+  - export ANDROID_BIN=$HOME/sdk/tools/bin
+  - export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/sdk
+  - export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=$HOME/sdk
+  # create empty cfg file to prevent sdkmanager warning message
+  - mkdir -p $HOME/.android && touch $HOME/.android/repositories.cfg
   - chmod +x gradlew
-
-before_cache:
-  - rm -f  $HOME/.gradle/caches/modules-2/modules-2.lock
-  - rm -fr $HOME/.gradle/caches/*/plugin-resolution/
-cache:
-  directories:
-    - $HOME/.gradle/caches/
-    - $HOME/.gradle/wrapper/
-    - $HOME/.android/build-cache
+  - $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --update --sdk_root=$ANDROID_HOME --no_https --verbose
+  - yes | $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --install "tools" --sdk_root=$ANDROID_HOME --no_https --verbose | grep -v = || true

replies.bodyText: Yes.  I've seen that break in some builds though... so i've opted not to do that for now.  We can revisit if it's performance pain in practice
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: Just me debugging something.  I'll remove in a separate PR.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: I'm going to fix it here.
replies.author: shoatman

timeline.bodyText: Do we want to use the API_VERSION variable on this line, instead of android-29? Same question for line 31
timeline.author: iambmelt
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,53 +1,49 @@
 # ./travis.yml for MSAL android
-language: android
-jdk: oraclejdk8
-
-# Don't use the Travis Container-Based Infrastructure
-sudo: true
+dist: bionic
 
 # Build Variables
 env:
   global:
-    - BUILD_TOOLS_VERSION=28.0.3
-    - COMPILE_SDK_VERSION=28
-    - EMULATOR_API_VERSION=21
-
-    # This is to guarantee a clean gradle log
-    - TERM=dumb
-
-android:
-  components:
-    - tools
-    - platform-tools
-    - build-tools-$BUILD_TOOLS_VERSION
-    - android-$COMPILE_SDK_VERSION
-    - extra-google-m2repository
-
-    ## Emulator config ##
-    # The SDK version used for the emulator
-    - android-$EMULATOR_API_VERSION
-
-    #system images
-    - sys-img-armeabi-v7a-android-$EMULATOR_API_VERSION
+    - BUILD_TOOLS_VERSION=29.0.3
+    - API_VERSION=29
+    - ANDROID_TOOLS=commandlinetools-linux-6609375_latest.zip
+    - ARCH=x86_64
 
 before_install:
+  # download and unzip Android SDK command line tools
+  - sudo apt install openjdk-8-jdk
+  - export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64 
+  - echo $JAVA_HOME
+  #- sudo update-alternatives --set java /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64/jre/bin/java
+  - wget -nv https://dl.google.com/android/repository/$ANDROID_TOOLS
+  - unzip -q $ANDROID_TOOLS -d $HOME/sdk
+  # set SDK tools path variable and ANDROID_HOME
+  - export ANDROID_BIN=$HOME/sdk/tools/bin
+  - export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/sdk
+  - export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=$HOME/sdk
+  # create empty cfg file to prevent sdkmanager warning message
+  - mkdir -p $HOME/.android && touch $HOME/.android/repositories.cfg
   - chmod +x gradlew
-
-before_cache:
-  - rm -f  $HOME/.gradle/caches/modules-2/modules-2.lock
-  - rm -fr $HOME/.gradle/caches/*/plugin-resolution/
-cache:
-  directories:
-    - $HOME/.gradle/caches/
-    - $HOME/.gradle/wrapper/
-    - $HOME/.android/build-cache
+  - $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --update --sdk_root=$ANDROID_HOME --no_https --verbose
+  - yes | $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --install "tools" --sdk_root=$ANDROID_HOME --no_https --verbose | grep -v = || true
+  - yes | $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --install "platforms;android-29" --sdk_root=$ANDROID_HOME --no_https --verbose | grep -v = || true

replies.bodyText: Do you know how to use this in a travis string?  I assumethere is syntax for this, but couldn't find easily
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: I'm going to work on this one later.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: Is it not just present in the environment that the command is running in? https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/environment-variables/ seems to suggest that.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: the problem is that whenever we change target version we need to download the new file and check it in the repo.....I'm thinking we can make it optional via cmd param....similar to how we've done a lot of other things...
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText:
I don't really know is this will work given travis and the SDK manager, but non-quoted variable expansion is dangerous.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              - $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --update --sdk_root=$ANDROID_HOME --no_https --verbose
          
          
            
              - $ANDROID_BIN/sdkmanager --update --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --no_https --verbose
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx
